full_summary:
** Tender Notice **

Title: Weather Observation Services – Upper Air Weather Station, Sept-Îles, QC

Solicitation Number: 5000075234R

Notice Type: Request for Proposal

Publish Date: January 18, 2024

Bid Closing Date: February 2, 2024, 2:00 p.m. (Eastern Time)

The Government of Canada is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers to provide Weather Observation Services at the Upper Air Weather Station in Sept-Îles, Quebec.

**Description**

Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) requires aerological observations at the Sept-Îles Upper Air Weather Station. The selected supplier will be responsible for providing these services on a periodic and contractual basis.

The security requirement for this solicitation is classified as Reliability level.

The contract duration is anticipated to commence on April 1, 2024, and terminate on March 31, 2027, with an optional extension of up to three (3) additional one (1) year periods.

**Eligibility and Requirements**

The bidder must provide a list of names and descriptions of all employees involved in the provision of services, as required in section 01 Integrity Provisions of Standard Instructions 2003.

**Notice of Trade Agreements**

This requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Notice of Social Procurement**

Environment and Climate Change Canada encourages businesses from under-represented groups, such as women, LGBTQ2+ persons, persons with disabilities, and visible minorities, to submit a proposal.

**Debriefing**

Bidders interested in receiving debriefing may request this within 15 working days from the closing date for submission of quotes.

**Official Languages**

The solicitation is available in both official languages and the preferred language of the bidders will be accepted.

**Award Criteria**

The award will be made following the evaluation and rating of the proposals, with the selection based on the highest combined rating of Technical Merit (70%) and Price (30%).

**Contact Information**

For any inquiries or additional information, please contact Michel Larivière, Contracting Officer at michel.larivière@ec.gc.ca or (819) 938-3816.
